item.title: Antony Blinken Pushes For Gaza Truce In Israel, Calls It "A Decisive Moment"
item.description: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken, in Israel to push for a Gaza truce, said on Monday ongoing negotiations were "maybe the last" chance to reach an agreement to end the war.

item.title: A Bittersweet Convention Farewell As Biden Passes Torch To Kamala Harris
item.description: US President Joe Biden will give a bittersweet farewell address at the Democratic National Convention in Chicago on Monday, passing the torch to Kamala Harris as the party's nominee for November's election.

item.title: Actors Mindy Kaling, Kerry Washington To Host Democratic Convention
item.description: As the Democratic National Convention is set to kick off in Chicago tonight, several prominent figures, including comedian-actress Mindy Kaling, actor Kerry Washington, Ana Navarro, and Tony Goldwyn, have been confirmed as hosts for the convention.

item.title: Ukraine aims to create Kursk ‘buffer zone,’ Zelensky says, as Kyiv’s forces blow up second Russian bridge - CNN
item.description:
1. Ukraine aims to create Kursk ‘buffer zone,’ Zelensky says, as Kyiv’s forces blow up second Russian bridge  CNN
  2. Russia Ukraine war latest: Kyiv blows up second bridge in Kursk as Ukrainian forces down 11 drones overnight  The Independent
  3. In Ukraine-controlled Sudzha, stranded Russian civilians question what’s next  The Washington Post
  4. Video appears to show Ukrainian strike on key Russian bridge, which Moscow says was likely carried out using US-made HIMARS rockets  Business Insider
  5. Ukraine war briefing: Kyiv says it destroyed second Kursk bridge as it seeks to disrupt supply routes  The Guardian

item.title: Blinken arrives in Israel to push cease-fire deal amid doubts of success - The Washington Post
item.description:
1. Blinken arrives in Israel to push cease-fire deal amid doubts of success  The Washington Post
  2. Blinken: possibly 'last opportunity' to release hostages and secure Gaza ceasefire – video  The Guardian US
  3. Herzog says Hamas refusal responsible for failure to reach hostage deal  The Times of Israel
  4. Blinken says it’s probably ‘the best, maybe the last’ chance for Gaza cease-fire  The Washington Post
  5. Blinken says current talks ‘maybe last’ chance to free captives from Gaza  Al Jazeera English

item.title: Outgoing Reynolds would’ve struggled in preselection after Higgins coverup allegation, party figure tells court
item.description:
The WA senator would have been at a ‘disadvantage’ to colleagues after her former staffer accused her of mishandling the rape allegation, a court has heard

  • Follow our Australia news live blog for latest updates
  • Get our morning and afternoon news emails, free app or daily news podcast

Linda Reynolds would be unlikely to win top spots on a Liberal election ticket because of her handling of Brittany Higgins’ alleged rape and accusations it was covered up, a senior party figure has told a defamation trial.

Senator Reynolds is suing her former staffer Higgins - who is defending the claim - over a series of social media posts containing alleged mistruths she believes damaged her reputation.

Continue reading...

item.title: Russia-Ukraine war live: Kursk incursion aims to create buffer zone to stop Russian attacks, says Zelenskiy
item.description:
Ukrainian president states aim of operation which launched on 6 August

Hello, welcome to our rolling coverage of the Russia-Ukraine war.

Volodymyr Zelenskiy has said Ukraine’s military incursion into Russia’s Kursk region aims to create a buffer zone to prevent further attacks by Moscow across the border.

Ukraine said it had struck a second key bridge in the Kursk region, seeking to disrupt Moscow’s supply routes as Kyiv’s unprecedented incursion on Russian soil stretched through its second week. “Minus one more bridge,” Ukrainian air force Commander Mykola Oleshchuk said on Telegram, publishing an aerial video of a blast tearing through a bridge near the Russian town of Zvannoye. “The air force aviation continues to deprive the enemy of logistical capabilities with precision airstrikes,” he said. On Friday, Ukraine announced it had destroyed a separate bridge in the neighbouring town of Glushkovo.

Ukraine has captured more than 150 Russian prisoners of war on some days in the cross-border military operation in Kursk, according to Oleksii Drozdenko, the head of the military administration in the Ukrainian city of Sumy. “Sometimes there are more than 100 or 150 prisoners of war a day,” Drozdenko said. Many of the Russian troops who have been guarding the border are young conscripts. “They do not want to fight us,” he added.

The Institute for the Study of War has “observed claims” that Ukraine’s operation in Kursk has advanced through 800 square kilometres over six days. The initial incursion “attacked largely unprepared, unequipped, and unmanned Russian defensive positions along the border”, the ISW said in its daily report on the conflict, adding that Ukraine has continued to make rapid advances in Kursk “following the deployment of Russian reinforcements to the area.”

Russian forces took control of the village of Svyrydonivka in Ukraine’s eastern Donetsk region, the TASS state news agency reported on Sunday, citing the defence ministry. The Guardian could not independently verify the battlefield report.

Russia on Sunday denied a report that Ukraine’s attack on the Kursk region had derailed indirect talks with Kyiv on halting strikes on energy and power targets, saying there had been no talks ongoing. The Washington Post reported on Saturday that Ukraine and Russia were set to send delegations to Qatar this month to negotiate a landmark agreement halting strikes on energy and power infrastructure on both warring sides. The Post said the agreement would have amounted to a partial ceasefire but that the talks were derailed due to Ukraine’s attack on Russian sovereign territory.

Russian President Vladimir Putin arrived in Azerbaijan’s capital Baku on Sunday for a two-day state visit, Russian news agencies reported. Russian television broadcast images of the Russian president’s plane as it arrived in Baku in the evening. Azerbaijan is a close partner of Moscow but also a major energy supplier to western countries, comes against the backdrop of an unprecedented Ukrainian military offensive on Russian soil.

Continue reading...

item.title: Former Saudi official alleges Prince Mohammed forged king's signature on Yemen war decree, BBC says
Mark Robinson, Who Often Calls Abortion Murder: ‘We Had an Abortion’
North Korea condemns Ukraine's incursion into Russia as act of terror
